intro: Bridelia burmanica, commonly known as Burmese bridelia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Bridelia burmanica is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
